repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Bahia Health System Reform Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Bahia Heath System
            Reform Program Project for Brazil were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            the Bank's policy for project restructuring offers a
            vehicle for adjusting project activities and indicators when
            implementation experience shows that either there was a
            problem with the original definition, or there is a need to
            adjust them to realistically achieve the project's
            development objectives. Despite the flexibility that has
            been introduced into the process recently, formal
            restructuring is not always seen as feasible because of the
            time and approval processes involved, both on the side of
            governments and of the Bank. This was the case for this
            project, when, at the time, restructuring was being
            considered a possibility. There needs to be either a more
            flexible vehicle for adjusting project indicators and
            activities, both in the Bank and in Governments, or an
            attempt to define project objectives and indicators in more
            general, flexible manner so that activities and indicators
            can be adapted and adjusted without the need for formal
            restructuring, all within the framework of governments'
            and the Bank's requirements.

5086757.trustfund: TF025822-PHRD-BRAZIL: BAHIA HEALTH PROJECT,TF037447-BRAZIL - BAHIA HEALTH

repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Bahia Health System Reform Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Bahia
            Health System Reform Project are to implement the national
            policy of health care decentralization seeking to improve
            access of the poor to Basic Health Care, with improved
            coverage and quality of those health interventions with
            greatest influence over child mortality, maternal mortality,
            and the incidence of diseases prevalent among the poor,
            reduce inequities in the allocation of publicly funded
            health care services, and, improve efficiency andquality in
            the use of public resources, Project components will : 1)
            strengthen the management, and governance of micro-regions,
            by enhancing the role of the micro-region as a purchaser of
            health care services. Technical assistance (TA) will be
            supported, for the deployment of performance based contracts
            between the micro-regions and their local providers,
            including TA, works, and equipment for the implementation of
            Regulation Centers. Furthermore, training, and TA will be
            provided for the adaptation of a unified health system card
            technology. The capacity of micro-regions will be
            strengthened in the conduct of clinical, environmental and
            financial audits, and to initiate as well, a process of
            accreditation, and, TA would support the preparation of
            Medical Waste Plans in health care facilities; 2) conduct
            and analyze health, demographic and social household surveys
            to provide a baseline for the project, and, support
            monitoring and evaluation requirements Likewise, policy
            studies will support implementation of payment systems
            reforms, and improvements in environmental management of
            medical waste. This component will finance technical
            assistance, and training for the introduction of performance
            contracting, the deployment of a Regulation Center for High
            Complexity Care at the state level, the strengthening of
            audit functions, and, accreditation of health care
            providers; and, 3) expand basic care, by strengthening the
            Pacto de Atencao Basica, i.e., Understanding on Basic Health
            Care provision. This sub-component will strengthen the
            state's role in planning, negotiating, monitoring and
            evaluating the "Pacto" through technical
            assistance, training, and equipment supply for the
            implementation of a state-level system of planning municipal
            targets, and, development of a system of consistency checks
            between the various databases pertaining to basic care.

439980.trustfund: TF025822-PHRD-BRAZIL: BAHIA HEALTH PROJECT,TF037447-BRAZIL - BAHIA HEALTH

repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Bahia State Health System Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Bahia State Health Reform Project
            will assist Bahia to improve the health status of its
            population.  Although the project does not have a direct
            impact on the environment, the implementation of health
            services and the generation of medical wastes as these
            health centers provide better services, might have a direct
            connotation with environmental implications.  The final
            disposition of medical and solid waste may impact
            surrounding natural resources and could generate negative
            effects.  Negative effects of the Project are related to
            construction; operation and maintenance of health centers,
            particularly in municipalities with limited resource to
            implement proper management; and final disposal of medical
            wastes.  The major mitigation measures proposed include
            implementation of existing environmental assessment and
            licensing of health centers; mandatory preparation of
            medical waste plans; technical assistance for solid waste
            management plans; incentives for proper solid waste
            management plans; implementation of environmental criteria
            in the audit of health services, construction, and
            supervision of infrastructure; and implementation of basic
            sanitation information.
